ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned to act and to be.
I learned a lot about acting as an art and a practice. I learned about the structure of plays, intention, connection with body, and awareness. I learned how to read for character and understand plot.

I developed a renewed and enhanced appreciation for the art of performance as well as the nature of the human experience and the means through which we convey it. The class helped me make meaningful progress toward my goals as an actor as well as reconceptualize what the art form requires and reevaluate my own commitment to the practice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: She could be more communicative about grades throughout the course.
Sohina was an awesome teacher! She is so passionate and made the course really interesting and fun. It was such a creative endeavor and it was to fun to get to play that much in an academic space.

I'm not sure of any weaknesses of the course outside of a lack of time (which I suppose is inevitable given the constraints of an academic class). As far as strengths go, I feel that Sohina provided comprehensive, empathetic instruction and feedback and appreciated the opportunities to perform in a range of styles and mediums as well as continually reflect on my work. If I have any recommendation for improvement, it might be additionally constructive to receive more feedback on our written work and reflections (not in an academic or structural sense but in terms of offering an evaluation of the extent to which Sohina shares the sentiments we discuss in our reflective work).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I learned a lot about theater but also a lot about myself. This course was the most fun part of my week and I always looked forward to it. If you take it, throw yourself in and buy in, it is well worth it.

Yes. I'm not sure who will be teaching the course going forward, but if you have any appreciation for or interest in performance, want to engage with the human condition, or just want to take a fun class where you do fun things, I highly recommend this course.
